Class DataManipulation

  org.energy_home.jemma.javagal.layers.data.implementations.Utils.DataManipulation

public class DataManipulation
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class with a number of data's manipulation methods.

Author:
"Ing. Marco Nieddu or from Consoft Sistemi S.P.A., financed by EIT ICT Labs activity SecSES - Secure Energy Systems (activity id 13030)"

toIntFromShort

public static int toIntFromShort(byte hb,
                                 byte lb)
Creates an int starting from two given shorts. An int is composed of four bytes. Numbering the four bytes from 1 (the most important) to 4 (the least important), the converted int will be formed placing the two given bytes in the two less important places of the created int.

More formally the low byte will be placed in position 4, the high byte will be placed in position 3, while positions 1 and 2 will be set at zero.

Parameters:
hb - the high byte.
lb - the low byte.
Returns:
the result int.

toLong

public static long toLong(byte _1,
                          byte _2,
                          byte _3,
                          byte _4,
                          byte _5,
                          byte _6,
                          byte _7,
                          byte _8)
Creates a long starting from eight given bytes. A long is composed of eight bytes. Numbering them from 1 (the most important) to 8 (the least important), the given bytes will be placed in the place indicated by their respective names.

Parameters:
_1 - byte placed in position 1
_2 - byte placed in position 2
_3 - byte placed in position 3
_4 - byte placed in position 4
_5 - byte placed in position 5
_6 - byte placed in position 6
_7 - byte placed in position 7
_8 - byte placed in position 8
Returns:
the resulting long

subByteArray

public static byte[] subByteArray(short[] array,
                                  int start,
                                  int stop)
Starts from a byte[] and returns a sub array, converted as byte[].

Parameters:
array - the original array
start - the start index, included
stop - the stop index, included
Returns:
the converted sub array

toByteVect

public static byte[] toByteVect(java.math.BigInteger toConvert,
                                int pad)
Converts a BigInteger to a byte[]. The resulting array will have all bytes contained in the BigInteger placed in the same position (from byte 0 to byte n). The pad parameter indicate the minimum size of the resulting array. In case its size would be less then the one indicated in the pad parameter, a number of leading zeros will be inserted.

Parameters:
toConvert - the BigInteger to convert.
pad - the minimum size of the returned array.
Returns:
the resulting array.

toByteVect

public static byte[] toByteVect(java.lang.Long toConvert,
                                int pad)
Converts a Long to a byte[]. A Long is composed of eight bytes. In case pad is set to 8, writes eight bytes containing the given Long value, in the current byte order. The pad parameter indicate the minimum size of the resulting array. In case its size would be less then the one indicated in the pad parameter, a number of leading zeros will be inserted.

Parameters:
toConvert - the Long to convert.
pad - the minimum size of the returned array.
Returns:
the resulting array.

toByteVect

public static byte[] toByteVect(int toConvert,
                                int pad)
Converts an int to a byte[]. An int is composed of four bytes. In case pad is set to 4, writes eight bytes containing the given int value, in the current byte order. The pad parameter indicate the minimum size of the resulting array. In case its size would be less then the one indicated in the pad parameter, a number of leading zeros will be inserted.

Parameters:
toConvert - the int to convert.
pad - the minimum size of the returned array.
Returns:
the resulting array.
